name: Course Vermont 2014
tagline: Materials for the Intro to R Using Fisheries Examples course in Vermont, March 2014.
body:
**Note that some links that are no longer active have been deleted**

## Course Preparation
This three-day workshop will provide an introduction to R for fisheries scientists.  R concepts and methods will be introduced through the use of a variety of fisheries examples.  The focus of this course, however, will be on developing foundational skills in R that can be transferred to other situations, rather than teaching specific fisheries methods.  Participants will test application of their knowledge with hands-on exercises using real fisheries data.

## Pre-Course Preparation
The first link below describes steps for installing R and RStudio on your laptop, which will be required to perform the course assignments.  The second link briefly describes how to use RStudio.  Please [contact me](mailto:dogle@northland.edu) with any questions.

* [Install R and RStudio](https://github.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/raw/master/CoursePrep/Installations.pdf) (complete before course) [The current versions of RStudio (now 0.98.XXX) and FSA (now 0.4.3) differ slightly from those shown here.  However, the procedural steps have not changed.]
* [Getting Started with RStudio](https://github.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/raw/master/CoursePrep/RStudio_GettingStarted.pdf) (review before course)
* You should download and bring to the course all slides, R Handout Scripts, and associated data files below.  Print [all R Handouts](https://github.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/raw/master/CourseMaterial/Vermont14_RHandouts_ALL.pdf) (1.2mb) to bring to the course.

## Course Materials
The following materials will be used during the course.  This ZIP file (7mb) contains all of the materials below (except for the fishR links).

* Introduction to R and RStudio
  * [Slides](https://github.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/raw/master/CourseMaterial/Slides/01_Introduction.pptx)
* R Basics and Terminology
  * [Handout](https://github.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/raw/master/CourseMaterial/02_BasicsTerminology.pdf) — [Script](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/master/CourseMaterial/Scripts/02_BasicsTerminology.R)
  * [Exercise](https://github.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/raw/master/CourseMaterial/Exercises/02_BasicsTerminology_EX.pdf) — Key
* R Data Reading and Manipulation
  * Description — fishR (Back-Calculation), [Slides](https://github.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/raw/master/CourseMaterial/Slides/03_BackCalc_DESC.pdf)
  * [Handout](https://github.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/raw/master/CourseMaterial/03_DataFrames.pdf) — [Script](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/master/CourseMaterial/Scripts/02_BasicsTerminology.R), [MNBCData.xlsx](https://github.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/raw/master/CourseMaterial/Data/MNBCData.xlsx), [MNBCData.CSV](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/master/CourseMaterial/Data/MNBCData.csv)
  * [Exercise — Data frames](https://github.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/raw/master/CourseMaterial/Exercises/03_DataFrames_EX.pdf) — [RuffeBio.XLSX](https://github.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/raw/master/CourseMaterial/Data/RUffeBio.xlsx), Key
  * [Exercise — Back-calculation](https://github.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/raw/master/CourseMaterial/Exercises/03_BackCalc_EX.pdf) — [MN98WaeYep.CSV](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/master/CourseMaterial/Data/MN98WaeYep.csv), Key
* Basic Summarizations and Plotting
  * [Handout](https://github.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/raw/master/CourseMaterial/04_Summaries.pdf) — [Script](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/master/CourseMaterial/Scripts/04_Summaries.R), [MNFats.CSV](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/master/CourseMaterial/Data/MNFats.csv)
  * [Exercise](https://github.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/raw/master/CourseMaterial/Exercises/04_Summaries_EX.pdf) — [LakeTroutALTER.CSV](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/master/CourseMaterial/Data/LakeTroutALTER.csv), Key
* Simple Linear Regression
  * Description — fishR (Length-Weight)
  * [Handout](https://github.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/raw/master/CourseMaterial/05_SLRegression.pdf) — [Script](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/master/CourseMaterial/Scripts/05_SLRegression.R), [MNFats.CSV](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/master/CourseMaterial/Data/MNFats.csv)
  * [Exercise](https://github.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/raw/master/CourseMaterial/Exercises/05_SLRegression_EX.pdf) — [LakeTroutALTER.CSV](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/master/CourseMaterial/Data/LakeTroutALTER.csv), Key
* One-Way ANOVA
  * Description — fishR (Relative Weight)
  * [Handout](https://github.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/raw/master/CourseMaterial/06_ANOVA1Way.pdf) — [Script](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/master/CourseMaterial/Scripts/06_ANOVA1Way.R), [Keuska99.CSV](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/master/CourseMaterial/Data/Keuska99.csv)
  * [Exercise](https://github.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/raw/master/CourseMaterial/Exercises/06_ANOVA1Way_EX.pdf) — [InchLake2.CSV](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/master/CourseMaterial/Data/InchLake2.csv), Key
* Non-Linear Regression
  * Description — fishR (Von Bertalanffy), [Slides](https://github.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/raw/master/CourseMaterial/Slides/07_Nonlinear_DESC.pdf)
  * [Handout](https://github.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/raw/master/CourseMaterial/07_Nonlinear.pdf) — [Script](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/master/CourseMaterial/Scripts/07_Nonlinear.R), [TroutBR.CSV](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/master/CourseMaterial/Data/TroutBR.csv)
  * [Exercise](https://github.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/raw/master/CourseMaterial/Exercises/07_Nonlinear_EX.pdf) — [LakeTroutALTER.CSV](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/master/CourseMaterial/Data/LakeTroutALTER.csv), Key
* Indicator Variable Regression
  * Description — fishR (Catch Curve)
  * [Handout](https://github.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/raw/master/CourseMaterial/08_IVRegression.pdf) — [Script](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/master/CourseMaterial/Scripts/08_IVRegression.R)
  * [Exercise](https://github.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/raw/master/CourseMaterial/Exercises/08_IVRegression_EX.pdf) — [LakeTroutALTER.CSV](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/master/CourseMaterial/Data/LakeTroutALTER.csv), Key
* Depletion Estimates (using K-Pass)
  * Description — fishR (Depletion)
  * [Handout](https://github.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/raw/master/CourseMaterial/09_KPassRemoval.pdf) — [Script](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/master/CourseMaterial/Scripts/09_KPassRemoval.R), [JonesStockwell2.CSV](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/master/CourseMaterial/Data/JonesStockwell2.csv)
  * [Exercise](https://github.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/raw/master/CourseMaterial/Exercises/09_KPassRemoval_EX.pdf) — [BrookTroutNEWP.csv](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/master/CourseMaterial/Data/BrookTroutNEWP.csv), Key
* Aging Data (Precision, Accuracy, and Bias)
  * Description — fishR, [Slides](https://github.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/raw/master/CourseMaterial/Slides/10_AgeComparisons_DESC.pptx)
  * [Handout](https://github.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/raw/master/CourseMaterial/10_AgeComparisons.pdf) — [Script](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/master/CourseMaterial/Scripts/10_AgeComparisons.R), [AlewifeLH.CSV](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/master/CourseMaterial/Data/AlewifeLH.csv), [StripedBass4.CSV](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/master/CourseMaterial/Data/StripedBass4.csv)
  * [Exercise](https://github.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/raw/master/CourseMaterial/Exercises/10_AgeComparisons_EX.pdf) — [WhitefishLC.CSV](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/master/CourseMaterial/Data/WhitefishLC.csv), Key
* Mark-Recapture (If time permits)
  * Description — fishR
  * [Handout](https://github.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/raw/master/CourseMaterial/11_MarkRecap.pdf) — [Script](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/master/CourseMaterial/Scripts/11_MarkRecap.R), [BluegillJL.CSV](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/master/CourseMaterial/Data/BluegillJL.csv), [PikeNYPartial1.CSV](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/master/CourseMaterial/Data/PikeNYPartial1.csv)
  * [Exercise](https://github.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/raw/master/CourseMaterial/Exercises/11_MarkRecap_EX.pdf) — [RBTroutUNSP.CSV](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/master/CourseMaterial/Data/RBTroutUNSP.csv), Key
* Age-Length Key (If time permits)
  * Description — fishR, [Slides](https://github.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/raw/master/CourseMaterial/Slides/12_AgeLengthKey_DESC.pptx)
  * [Handout](https://github.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/raw/master/CourseMaterial/12_AgeLengthKey.pdf) — [Script](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/master/CourseMaterial/Scripts/12_AgeLengthKey.R), [SpotVA2.CSV](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/master/CourseMaterial/Data/SpotVA2.csv)
  * [Exercise](https://github.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/raw/master/CourseMaterial/Exercises/12_AgeLengthKey_EX.pdf) — [RockBassLO2.CSV](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/droglenc/courseVermont2014/master/CourseMaterial/Data/RockBassLO2.csv), Key

## Follow-Up
Please complete this survey regarding this workshop. Following the course, if you have any questions please feel free to contact me.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
